intro: Chorizanthe staticoides var. brevispina, commonly known as the short-spined jointweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid environments. This species is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
